claim.text: he wrote from Berkeley, where summer highs rarely exceed 30°C
claim.claim: Berkeley, California summer high temperatures rarely exceed 30°C

results.summary: Berkeley's Mediterranean climate features moderate summer temperatures due to marine influence and fog, with average highs typically in the 20-24°C range and rarely exceeding 30°C.
results.detail: Berkeley's location on San Francisco Bay with exposure to Pacific Ocean fog and marine air keeps summer temperatures moderate. Average summer highs are approximately 20-24°C (68-75°F). While heat waves occasionally push temperatures above 30°C (86°F), these events are infrequent, making 'rarely exceeds 30°C' an accurate characterization. The claim reflects Berkeley's well-documented mild Mediterranean climate.
sources: General climatological knowledge of San Francisco Bay Area climate patterns
